controller_id.description: VESC ID. Used to identify this VESC on the CAN-bus.

timeout_msec.description: Switch off the motor when no input has beed received for this amount of time. Notice that VESC Tool will send alive packets while connected, so the timeout won't occur before you disconnect VESC Tool even if the input gets disconnected.

timeout_brake_current.description: Apply brake with this amount of current after a timeout.

send_can_status.description: Send a status message on the CAN bus with a periodic interval. Useful for letting other VESCs know which VESCs are on the CAN-bus. This is required by some apps to function with multiple VESCs. The master VESC of the app does not need this option checked.

send_can_status_rate_hz.description: Rate at which CAN status messages are sent on the CAN-bus.

can_baud_rate.description: The baud rate of the CAN-Bus. Note that all devices on the bus must have the same baud rate.

pairing_done.description: Pairing done flag. If this flag is set, a bluetooth connection can only be made if the VESC Tool instance making the connection has been paired to this VESC. The pairing is done by storing the UUID of the VESC in the pairing list.

permanent_uart_enabled.description: Enable the permanent UART port (if the hardware has one). This port can be connected to e.g. the NRF51 for providing a BLE link. You may want to disable this to prevent access to your VESC over BLE.

uavcan_enable.description: Use UAVCAN instead of the default CAN-implementation.

uavcan_esc_index.description: ESC index in UAVCAN messages.

app_to_use.description: The APP to use. With multiple VESC connected over CAN only the master needs to have an app to use set up. Notice that using the NRF nunchuk needs the NRF app.

app_ppm_conf.ctrl_type.description:
Off

The output is switched off regardless of the input.


Current

Current control. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center brakes until the motor stops, at which point it it starts in the reverse direction.


Current No Reverse

Current control. The output is off when the input is at minimum.


Current No Reverse With Brake

Current control. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center brakes until the motor stops, but not further.


Duty Cycle

Current control. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center gives negative duty cycle.


Duty Cycle No Reverse

Duty cycle control. The output is off when the input is at minimum.


PID Speed Control

PID speed control. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center gives negative set speed.


PID Speed Control No Reverse

Duty cycle control. The output is off when the input is at minimum.

app_ppm_conf.pid_max_erpm.description: The ERPM setpoint corresponding to max input when using PID Speed Control.

app_ppm_conf.hyst.description: Deadband region for the input.

app_ppm_conf.pulse_start.description: The shortest pulse length for the PPM input in milliseconds. Can be checked by enabling display and giving the minimum input.

app_ppm_conf.pulse_end.description: The longest pulse length for the PPM input in milliseconds. Can be checked by enabling display and giving the maximum input.

app_ppm_conf.pulse_center.description: The PPM input in milliseconds at which the throttle is centered. Can be checked by enabling display and leaving the throttle centered. This setting has no effect in control modes where the output is not off when the stick is centered.

app_ppm_conf.median_filter.description: Use a median filter on the decoded pulses. Will delay the signal slightly, but rejects outliers caused by noise.

app_ppm_conf.safe_start.description: Only allow the motor to start if the commanded power has been zero for several cycles after boot, after faults and after configuration updates.

app_ppm_conf.throttle_exp.description:
Exponential gain for the throttle.


Zero (0)

Linear throttle


Negative (<0)

The throttle is softer close to 0 and increases exponentially towards full throttle.


Positive (>0)

The throttle reacts fast around 0 and decreases exponentially towards full throttle.


Increasing the magnitude of this value will increase the exponential effect. The full throttle curve can be seen in the throttle curve plot.

app_ppm_conf.throttle_exp_brake.description:
Exponential gain for the throttle.


Zero (0)

Linear throttle


Negative (<0)

The throttle is softer close to 0 and increases exponentially towards full throttle.


Positive (>0)

The throttle reacts fast around 0 and decreases exponentially towards full throttle.


Increasing the magnitude of this value will increase the exponential effect. The full throttle curve can be seen in the throttle curve plot.

app_ppm_conf.throttle_exp_mode.description:
The throttle curve mode.


Exponential

y = x^(1 + c)


Natural

y = (e^(cx) - 1) / (e^c - 1)


Polynomial

y = x / (1 + c(1 - x))


where


y: output

x: input

c: curve


The curve parameter, offsets and signs are mapped accordingly for each mode.

app_ppm_conf.ramp_time_pos.description: Positive ramping time constant. This filters the input with ramping. This constant represents the amount of secods it takes to ramp from zero to full output.

app_ppm_conf.ramp_time_neg.description: Negative ramping time constant. This filters the input with ramping. This constant represents the amount of secods it takes to ramp from full output (acceleration or braking) back to zero.

app_ppm_conf.multi_esc.description: Listen for other VESCs on the CAN-bus and send the same control commands to them. Notice that the application only has to be set up on the master VESC.

app_ppm_conf.tc.description: Enable traction control between multiple VESCs connected over CAN-bus. This is only is only used for current control modes.

app_ppm_conf.tc_max_diff.description: The ERPM difference at which the fastest motor gets swtiched off completely. If the difference in ERPM is lower than that the current to faster motors is scaled down proportionally to the difference.

app_adc_conf.ctrl_type.description:
Off

The output is switched off regardless of the input.


Current

Current control. The output is off when the input is at minimum.


Current Reverse Center

Current control. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center brakes until the motor stops, at which point it it starts in the reverse direction.


Current Reverse Button

Current control with a button for reversing the throttle. The output is off when the input is at minimum.


Current Reverse ADC2 Brake Button

Current control with a button for reversing the throttle. The output is off when the input is at minimum. The second ADC channel acs as a brake.


ADC_CTRL_TYPE_CURRENT_REV_BUTTON_BRAKE_CENTER

Current control with a button for reversing throttle. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center brakes until the motor stops, but not further.


Current No Reverse Brake Center

Current control. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center brakes until the motor stops, but not further.


Current No Reverse Brake Button

Current control with a button for turning the throttle into a brake. The output is off when the input is at minimum.


Current No Reverse Brake ADC2

Current control with one separate throttle connected to ADC2 for braking.


Duty Cycle

Duty cycle control. The output is off when the input is at minimum.


Duty Cycle Reverse Center

Current control. The output is off when the input is centered. Input less than center gives negative duty cycle.


Duty Cycle Reverse Button

Duty cycle control with a button on UART RX for inverting the throttle. The output is off when the input is at minimum.


PID Speed

PID speed control. The speed setpoint is mapped between 0 and the configured maximum motor speed limit.


PID Speed Reverse Center

PID speed control. The output is mapped between the minimum and maximum motor speed limits. Throttle center corresponds to 0 speed.


PID Speed Reverse Button

PID speed control with a button for reversing the throttle. The speed setpoint is mapped between 0 and the configured maximum motor speed limit, or between 0 and the minimum motor speed limit when the UART RX input is high.

app_adc_conf.hyst.description: Deadband region for the input.

app_adc_conf.voltage_start.description: Input voltage at the start of the throttle range for ADC1. Can be checked by enabling display and giving the minimum input. If Control Type is set to off while doing that the motor won't turn.

app_adc_conf.voltage_end.description: Input voltage at the end of the throttle range for ADC1. Can be checked by enabling display and giving the maximum input. If Control Type is set to off while doing that the motor won't turn.

app_adc_conf.voltage_center.description:
Input voltage at the center of the throttle range for ADC1. Can be checked by enabling display and centering the input. If Control Type is set to off while doing that the motor won't turn.


Notice that this parameter only is used for the contered control types. For the other types the voltage will always be mapped linearly between start and end.

app_adc_conf.voltage2_start.description: Input voltage at the start of the throttle range for ADC2. Can be checked by enabling display and giving the minimum input. If Control Type is set to off while doing that the motor won't turn.

app_adc_conf.voltage2_end.description: Input voltage at the end of the throttle range for ADC2. Can be checked by enabling display and giving the maximum input. If Control Type is set to off while doing that the motor won't turn.

app_adc_conf.use_filter.description: Use a median filter to reject noise. This will introduce a slight delay.

app_adc_conf.safe_start.description: Only allow the motor to start if the commanded power has been zero for several cycles after boot, after faults and after configuration updates.

app_adc_conf.cc_button_inverted.description: Invert the cruise control button. For supporting both normally-closed and normally-open buttons.

app_adc_conf.rev_button_inverted.description: Invert the reverse button. For supporting both normally-closed and normally-open buttons.

app_adc_conf.voltage_inverted.description: Invert the voltage from ADC1.

app_adc_conf.voltage2_inverted.description: Invert the voltage from ADC2.

app_adc_conf.throttle_exp.description:
Exponential gain for the throttle.


Zero (0)

Linear throttle


Negative (<0)

The throttle is softer close to 0 and increases exponentially towards full throttle.


Positive (>0)

The throttle reacts fast around 0 and decreases exponentially towards full throttle.


Increasing the magnitude of this value will increase the exponential effect. The full throttle curve can be seen in the throttle curve plot.

app_adc_conf.throttle_exp_brake.description:
Exponential gain for the throttle.


Zero (0)

Linear throttle


Negative (<0)

The throttle is softer close to 0 and increases exponentially towards full throttle.


Positive (>0)

The throttle reacts fast around 0 and decreases exponentially towards full throttle.


Increasing the magnitude of this value will increase the exponential effect. The full throttle curve can be seen in the throttle curve plot.

app_adc_conf.throttle_exp_mode.description:
The throttle curve mode.


Exponential

y = x^(1 + c)


Natural

y = (e^(cx) - 1) / (e^c - 1)


Polynomial

y = x / (1 + c(1 - x))


where


y: output

x: input

c: curve


The curve parameter, offsets and signs are mapped accordingly for each mode.

app_adc_conf.ramp_time_pos.description: Positive ramping time constant. This filters the input with ramping. This constant represents the amount of secods it takes to ramp from zero to full output.

app_adc_conf.ramp_time_neg.description: Negative ramping time constant. This filters the input with ramping. This constant represents the amount of secods it takes to ramp from full output (acceleration or braking) back to zero.

app_adc_conf.multi_esc.description: Listen for other VESCs on the CAN-bus and send the same control commands to them. Notice that the application only has to be set up on the master VESC.

app_adc_conf.tc.description: Enable traction control between multiple VESCs connected over CAN-bus. This is only is only used for current control modes.

app_adc_conf.tc_max_diff.description: The ERPM difference at which the fastest motor gets swtiched off completely. If the difference in ERPM is lower than that the current to faster motors is scaled down proportionally to the difference.

app_adc_conf.update_rate_hz.description: Rate at which the input is sampled.

app_uart_baudrate.description: UART Baudrate.

app_chuk_conf.ctrl_type.description:
Off

The output is switched off regardless of the input.


Current

Current control. The output is off when the joystick is centered. Positive input gives acceleration and negative input braking. To go reverse the Z button can be used to toggle direction.


Current No Reverse

Current control. The output is off when the joystick is centered. Positive input gives acceleration and negative input braking. The reverse function of the Z button is disabled.

app_chuk_conf.hyst.description: Deadband region for the input.

app_chuk_conf.ramp_time_pos.description: Positive ramping time constant. This filters the joystick input with ramping. This constant represents the amount of secods it takes to ramp from zero to full output.

app_chuk_conf.ramp_time_neg.description: Negative ramping time constant. This filters the joystick input with ramping. This constant represents the amount of secods it takes to ramp from full output (acceleration or braking) back to zero.

app_chuk_conf.stick_erpm_per_s_in_cc.description: The amount of ERPM per second the setpoint changes when giving full joystick input with criuse control activated.

app_chuk_conf.throttle_exp.description:
Exponential gain for the throttle.


Zero (0)

Linear throttle


Negative (<0)

The throttle is softer close to 0 and increases exponentially towards full throttle.


Positive (>0)

The throttle reacts fast around 0 and decreases exponentially towards full throttle.


Increasing the magnitude of this value will increase the exponential effect. The full throttle curve can be seen in the throttle curve plot.

app_chuk_conf.throttle_exp_brake.description:
Exponential gain for the throttle.


Zero (0)

Linear throttle


Negative (<0)

The throttle is softer close to 0 and increases exponentially towards full throttle.


Positive (>0)

The throttle reacts fast around 0 and decreases exponentially towards full throttle.


Increasing the magnitude of this value will increase the exponential effect. The full throttle curve can be seen in the throttle curve plot.

app_chuk_conf.throttle_exp_mode.description:
The throttle curve mode.


Exponential

y = x^(1 + c)


Natural

y = (e^(cx) - 1) / (e^c - 1)


Polynomial

y = x / (1 + c(1 - x))


where


y: output

x: input

c: curve


The curve parameter, offsets and signs are mapped accordingly for each mode.

app_chuk_conf.multi_esc.description: Listen for other VESCs on the CAN-bus and send the same control commands to them. Notice that the application only has to be set up on the master VESC.

app_chuk_conf.tc.description: Enable traction control between multiple VESCs connected over CAN-bus. This is only is only used for current control modes.

app_chuk_conf.tc_max_diff.description: The ERPM difference at which the fastest motor gets swtiched off completely. If the difference in ERPM is lower than that the current to faster motors is scaled down proportionally to the difference.

app_nrf_conf.speed.description: The air bit rate.

app_nrf_conf.power.description: Transmit power or power off setting.

app_nrf_conf.crc_type.description: CRC checksum type.

app_nrf_conf.retry_delay.description: Delay between retries when no ack is received. If the speed is lower than 2MBit, at least 500 S should be used.

app_nrf_conf.retries.description: Maximum number of retries when no ack is received before giving up on the current packet.

app_nrf_conf.channel.description: Radio channel.

app_nrf_conf.address__0.description: Address byte 0.

app_nrf_conf.address__1.description: Address byte 1.

app_nrf_conf.address__2.description: Address byte 2.

app_nrf_conf.send_crc_ack.description: Send ACK when valid packets are received.
